publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: J reach all things near me & far off to boot Without stretching a finger or striveing a foot? take 'em all in too to add to your wonderTho' many, & various and large, & asunder?hithout jostling or crowding they pass side by sideThro' a wonderfull wicket not half an Jnch wide?hen J lodge 'em att ease in a very large storeOf no breath or lenght with a thousand things more?ll this J can do without witchcraft or charmTho' sometimes they say J bewitch and do harm,?ho' cold J inflame, and tho' quiet invadeAnd nothing can shield from my spill but a Shade?Theif yt has rob'd you, or done you disgraceJn magical mirrour, J'll show you his face,?ay, if You'll believe what ye Poets have said,They'll tell you, J kill and call back ye dead?ike Conjurours safe in my Circle J dwellJ love to look black too, it heightens my spell?o my Magick is mighty in every hue.Who sees all my Power, must see it in you.938A420B
